meanings.def: to provide somebody with a room or place to sleep, live or sit
examples: The hotel can accommodate up to 500 guests.
The aircraft is capable of accommodating 28 passengers.

meanings.def: to provide enough space for somebody/something
examples: The garage can accommodate three cars.
The old town hall now accommodates a Folk Museum.

meanings.def: to consider something such as somebody’s opinion or a fact and be influenced by it when you are deciding what to do or explaining something
examples: Our proposal tries to accommodate the special needs of minority groups.
She modified her views so as to accommodate the objections of American feminists.

meanings.def: to help somebody by doing what they want
examples: I have accommodated the press a great deal, giving numerous interviews.
I’m sure the bank will be able to accommodate you.

meanings.def: to change your behaviour so that you can deal with a new situation better
examples: I needed to accommodate to the new schedule.
